revised_title: Investigation of Parallax of a Aquilae
tldr: John Pond, Astronomer Royal, investigates the parallax of a Aquilae using a telescope with an achromatic object-glass. Despite fifty-four observations, no appearance of parallax is found, and the author considers it a challenging task to establish its existence on a star far from the zenith. However, he plans to continue the investigation and communicate the results to the Royal Society.
